docs.lead_paragraph: If Democrats break down their major health care legislation into components that could be approved separately, the first bill up for consideration could be a proposal to end the exemption from federal antitrust laws that insurers have enjoyed since 1945.
docs.abstract: Democratic leaders may have identified the first piece of health care legislation with a fair shot at passing on its own.
docs.snippet: Democratic leaders may have identified the first piece of health care legislation with a fair shot at passing on its own.

docs.lead_paragraph: In his extraordinary question-and-answer exchange with House Republicans, President Obama fielded a query from Representative Jason Chaffetz, a freshman from Utah, who asserted that Mr. Obama and Democrats had shut Republicans out of the health care debate and that the president had broken a campaign promise to let C-Span show health care negotiations on live television.

headline.main: Fact Check 2: Obama and House Republicans

docs.abstract: President Obama acknowledged that some of the negotiations over health care were hidden from view.
docs.snippet: President Obama acknowledged that some of the negotiations over health care were hidden from view.

docs.lead_paragraph: Update | 3:50 p.m. Part two of this post is here.

headline.main: Fact Check: Obama and House Republicans

docs.abstract: The president locked horns with House Republicans on Friday over their ideas for changing the health care system.
docs.snippet: The president locked horns with House Republicans on Friday over their ideas for changing the health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you've lost your job, or suffered a big drop in income, you may have a significantly different tax situation from previous years.

headline.main: Tax Tips for the Unemployed and Financially Distressed

docs.abstract: If you've lost your job, or suffered a big drop in income, you may have a dramatically different tax situation than in previous years. This post provides tips for people who are affected by the recession.

docs.lead_paragraph: This Mark Schmitt piece on the tug-of-war within liberalism dovetails with some of the themes I've been exploring lately. He writes:
